questions.question: Why did Dick decide to go to London?

options.text: He heard the streets were paved with gold

questions.answer: He heard the streets were paved with gold

questions.question: Who helped Dick reach London?
questions.answer: A carter

questions.question: Where did Dick sleep on his first night in London?
questions.answer: In an alley

questions.question: Who gave Dick work and shelter?
questions.answer: Mr Fitzwarren

questions.question: Why did Dick buy a cat?
questions.answer: To catch rats and mice

questions.question: What made Dick unhappy in the house?
questions.answer: Cook’s bad temper

questions.question: What did the bells seem to say to Dick?
questions.answer: Turn again Whittington

questions.question: What did Dick send on the ship?
questions.answer: His cat

questions.question: Why did the captain accept the cat?
questions.answer: It was a good mouser

questions.question: Where did the ship go?
questions.answer: Barbary on the African coast

questions.question: Who suffered from rats in the foreign palace?
questions.answer: The king

questions.question: What did the cat do in the palace?
questions.answer: Killed the rats and mice

questions.question: What did the king give in return for the cat?
questions.answer: A great sum of money

questions.question: Who became rich because of the cat?
questions.answer: Dick

questions.question: What lesson does the story teach?
questions.answer: Never lose hope

questions.question: What was Dick’s condition when he reached London?
questions.answer: He was tired and hungry

questions.question: Why could Dick not sleep in the attic?
questions.answer: Rats and mice troubled him

questions.question: From whom did Dick buy the cat?
questions.answer: A little girl

questions.question: Why did Dick want to leave London?

options.text: He was unhappy with the cook’s behaviour

questions.answer: He was unhappy with the cook’s behaviour

questions.question: Where was Dick when he heard the bells?
questions.answer: On Highgate Hill

questions.question: What made Dick turn back to London?
questions.answer: The ringing of the bells

questions.question: What was sent with the ship apart from goods?
questions.answer: Dick’s cat

questions.question: Why was the king pleased with the cat?
questions.answer: It saved him from rats

questions.question: What problem troubled the palace before the cat arrived?
questions.answer: Rats and mice

questions.question: What happened after the cat caught the rats?
questions.answer: The king rewarded Dick generously

questions.question: What change came in Dick’s life after the ship returned?
questions.answer: He became rich

questions.question: What quality of Dick is shown when he sends his only possession?
questions.answer: Hope

questions.question: What did Dick hear on Highgate Hill?
questions.answer: Church bells

questions.question: Why was the palace full of rats?

options.text: Because there were no cats in that country

questions.answer: Because there were no cats in that country

questions.question: Who sold the cat to Dick?
questions.answer: A little girl

questions.question: What made Dick hopeful again?
questions.answer: The sound of the bells

questions.question: Which quality of Dick helped him succeed?
questions.answer: Perseverance

questions.question: What did Dick think London would be like?
questions.answer: Streets paved with gold

questions.question: What lesson does the story teach us?
questions.answer: Never lose hope

questions.question: What does the cat symbolise in the story?
questions.answer: Luck and opportunity

questions.question: What did Dick carry when he first left his village?
questions.answer: Nothing but hope

questions.question: How did the people in London treat Dick initially?
questions.answer: Rudely

questions.question: Where was Dick asked to sleep in Mr Fitzwarren’s house?
questions.answer: In the attic

questions.question: Why was the cat very valuable in the foreign land?
questions.answer: There were no cats there

questions.question: What made the cook angry with Dick?
questions.answer: She had a bad temper

questions.question: What did Dick do after hearing the bells?
questions.answer: He turned back to London

questions.question: Who encouraged Dick to send his cat?
questions.answer: Mr Fitzwarren

questions.question: What was the reaction of the king after seeing the cat?
questions.answer: He was delighted

questions.question: What happened to the rats after the cat arrived?
questions.answer: They were killed

questions.question: How was Dick rewarded?
questions.answer: With gold and riches

questions.question: What change came in Dick’s social status?
questions.answer: He became respected and rich

questions.question: What quality of Dick is shown through the story?
questions.answer: Hard work and hope

questions.question: What role did the bells play in Dick’s life?
questions.answer: They gave him hope

questions.question: Why is the story called inspirational?

options.text: Because it teaches never to give up

questions.answer: Because it teaches never to give up

questions.question: What is the best title theme of the story?
questions.answer: Hope and perseverance

questions.question: Why did Dick leave his village for London?
questions.answer: Dick heard that the streets of London were paved with gold. He believed he could become rich there. This innocent belief made him leave his village in hope of a better life.

questions.question: Describe Dick’s first night in London.
questions.answer: Dick found no shelter or food in London. He slept in an alley on the streets. The night was cold and uncomfortable for him.

questions.question: How did Mr Fitzwarren help Dick?
questions.answer: Mr Fitzwarren ordered the cook to feed Dick and give him work. He also provided him shelter in the attic. Thus Dick got safety and support.

questions.question: Why was Dick unable to sleep in the attic?
questions.answer: The attic was full of rats and mice. They ran over Dick’s body while he slept. This made his nights very painful and restless.

questions.question: Why did Dick buy a cat?
questions.answer: Dick bought a cat to catch the rats and mice in the attic. He hoped the cat would help him sleep peacefully. It was his only valuable possession.

questions.question: Why did Dick decide to leave Mr Fitzwarren’s house?
questions.answer: The cook was very cruel and always scolded Dick. He felt sad and unhappy. Therefore he decided to leave the house.

questions.question: What made Dick turn back to London?
questions.answer: Dick heard the church bells ringing on Highgate Hill. They seemed to say “Turn again Whittington”. This filled him with hope and he returned.

questions.question: Why was Dick’s cat sent on the ship?
questions.answer: Mr Fitzwarren sent Dick’s cat along with goods. Dick had nothing else to send. The cat was his only contribution.

questions.question: What problem did the king face in the foreign land?
questions.answer: The king’s palace was full of rats and mice. They destroyed food and troubled everyone. There were no cats in that country.

questions.question: How did the cat help the king?
questions.answer: The cat killed all the rats and mice in the palace. The king was finally able to live peacefully. He was very pleased with the cat.

questions.question: What reward did Dick receive?
questions.answer: The king gave a huge amount of money in return for the cat. When the ship returned, Dick became rich. His life completely changed.

questions.question: How did Dick’s life change after becoming rich?
questions.answer: Dick was no longer poor and helpless. He became respected and successful. His hard days came to an end.

questions.question: What role did hope play in Dick’s success?
questions.answer: Hope never left Dick even in hard times. The bells filled him with courage. Because of hope, he returned and succeeded.

questions.question: What does the cat symbolise in the story?
questions.answer: The cat symbolises luck and opportunity. It changed Dick’s life completely. It proves that even small things can bring big success.

questions.question: Why is the story inspiring?
questions.answer: The story teaches us not to give up in difficult times. Dick remained hopeful and hardworking. Finally, he achieved success.

questions.question: Describe the character of Dick Whittington.
questions.answer: Dick was poor but hardworking and hopeful. He never lost courage. His patience and faith helped him change his destiny.

questions.question: What lesson does the story teach?
questions.answer: The story teaches that we should never lose hope. Hard work and faith bring success. Difficulties are part of life.

questions.question: Why was the cat so valuable in the foreign country?
questions.answer: There were no cats in that country. Rats troubled everyone. Therefore the cat became extremely valuable.

questions.question: How did Mr Fitzwarren treat Dick after his success?
questions.answer: Mr Fitzwarren was very happy for Dick. He treated him with respect. Dick became an important person in his house.

questions.question: Why is Dick called a fortunate boy?
questions.answer: Dick was very poor in the beginning. But because of his cat and hope, he became rich. His life changed completely.

questions.question: Why did Dick Whittington decide to leave his village and go to London?
questions.answer: He overheard someone say that the streets of London were paved with gold, and he hoped to find fortune and kindness there.

questions.question: How did Dick travel to London?
questions.answer: A carter gave him a lift in his cart after meeting him on the road.

questions.question: What was Dick's first impression of London?
questions.answer: He was dismayed because he saw only dirty streets and unfriendly people, not the gold he expected.

questions.question: How did Mr. Fitzwarren first help Dick?
questions.answer: He ordered his cook to feed Dick and then give him work and shelter.

questions.question: What job was Dick given at Mr. Fitzwarren's house?
questions.answer: He helped the cook with pots and pans in the kitchen.

questions.question: What problem did Dick face in the attic where he slept?
questions.answer: The attic was overrun with rats and mice that kept him awake at night.

questions.question: How did Dick solve the problem of rats and mice?
questions.answer: He saved his pennies and bought a cat, which chased them all away.

questions.question: Why did Dick decide to run away from Mr. Fitzwarren's house?
questions.answer: He could no longer tolerate the cook's bad temper and constant scolding.

questions.question: What made Dick change his mind and return?
questions.answer: He heard church bells ringing a message that seemed to say he would become Lord Mayor of London.

questions.question: What did Mr. Fitzwarren offer to his household regarding his trading ship?
questions.answer: He offered them a chance to send something on the ship to share in the profits if the voyage succeeded.

questions.question: What was the only thing Dick could send on the ship?
questions.answer: His cat was the only thing he owned.

questions.question: Why was the captain delighted to take Dick's cat on the ship?
questions.answer: Because it was an excellent mouser and would keep rats and mice off the ship.

questions.question: What problem did the kingdom of Barbary face?
questions.answer: They suffered from a plague of rats and mice that ate their food.

questions.question: How did the cat prove useful at the palace?
questions.answer: It pounced and killed many rats and mice that were eating the food.

questions.question: Why was the queen initially afraid of the cat?
questions.answer: She had seen how fiercely it attacked the rats and mice.

questions.question: What did the king offer in exchange for the cat?
questions.answer: He paid ten times the price of the entire cargo for the cat alone.

questions.question: How did Dick's life change after the ship returned?
questions.answer: He became rich, was respected as Mr. Whittington, and eventually became a successful merchant.

questions.question: What title did Dick receive later in life?
questions.answer: He was knighted by the king and became Sir Richard Whittington.

questions.question: What moral values did Dick show after becoming rich?
questions.answer: He was kind, generous, and helped the poor with his money.

questions.question: What does the story teach about perseverance?
questions.answer: It shows that perseverance, even in hardship, can lead to unexpected fortune and success.

questions.question: Why is Dick Whittington considered a worthy citizen?
questions.answer: Because he rose from poverty, worked hard, became successful, and helped others.

questions.question: What role did luck play in Dick's success?
questions.answer: Luck played a part (the cat's value), but his kindness, hard work, and courage were more important.

questions.question: How did Mr. Fitzwarren's fairness help Dick?
questions.answer: He gave Dick a chance, treated him fairly, and allowed him to prosper from his own possession.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'streets paved with gold' symbolize?
questions.answer: It symbolizes false hopes or exaggerated expectations of easy wealth.

questions.question: Why did Dick's cat become so valuable in Barbary?
questions.answer: Because cats were rare there, and it solved their serious rat problem.

questions.question: What quality of Dick's cat impressed the queen?
questions.answer: Its ability to be both fierce with pests and gentle with people.

questions.question: How did the church bells influence Dick's decision?
questions.answer: They seemed to give him a hopeful message about his future, encouraging him to return.

questions.question: What lesson does the story offer about kindness to strangers?
questions.answer: Kindness to strangers (like Mr. Fitzwarren's) can change lives and bring rewards.

questions.question: Why is Dick's story still told today?
questions.answer: It is a classic rags-to-riches tale that teaches hope, hard work, and humility.

questions.question: What does the term 'mouser' mean?
questions.answer: An animal that catches mice.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'paved with gold' symbolize in the story?
questions.answer: It symbolizes false hopes and unrealistic expectations of easy wealth that Dick initially believed.

questions.question: How did Dick feel when he first arrived in London?
questions.answer: He felt dismayed, disappointed, and alone because London was not as he imagined.

questions.question: What did Dick do when he could no longer tolerate the cook's behavior?
questions.answer: He decided to run away early one morning with his cat.

questions.question: What message did Dick hear from the church bells?
questions.answer: He heard: 'Turn again Whittington, Thou worthy citizen, Lord Mayor of London.'

questions.question: How did Mr. Fitzwarren's offer to send goods benefit his household?
questions.answer: It gave them a chance to invest and share profits from successful trade voyages.

questions.question: Why was Alice concerned about Dick sending his cat?
questions.answer: She knew how much Dick loved his cat and offered to contribute something on his behalf.

questions.question: What was the king's reaction to seeing the cat in action?
questions.answer: He was delighted and willing to pay a very high price for the cat.

questions.question: How did Dick's life improve after the cat was sold?
questions.answer: He became wealthy, gained respect, and eventually married Alice Fitzwarren.

questions.question: What lesson can young people learn from Dick's story?
questions.answer: Hard work, perseverance, kindness, and belief in oneself can lead to success.

questions.question: What does the term 'plague of rats and mice' mean in the story?
questions.answer: It means a severe infestation causing great trouble and destruction.

questions.question: Why did the captain bring the cat to the palace?
questions.answer: To demonstrate how it could solve the kingdom's rat and mouse problem.

questions.question: How did Dick show gratitude after becoming successful?
questions.answer: He helped the poor and shared his wealth with those in need.

questions.question: What role did honesty play in Dick's story?
questions.answer: Dick's honesty in having only a cat to send was rewarded with great fortune.

questions.question: Why is Dick's cat considered a hero in the story?
questions.answer: Because it solved a major problem for a kingdom and brought wealth to Dick.

questions.question: How did Mr. Fitzwarren demonstrate fairness to Dick?
questions.answer: He insisted that only Dick's own possession (the cat) be sent, not someone else's gift.

questions.question: What does Dick's journey from poverty to wealth teach about opportunity?
questions.answer: It teaches that opportunities can come from unexpected places and actions.

questions.question: Why did Dick name his cat 'Puss'?
questions.answer: That was the name she responded to, as told by the captain to the queen.

questions.question: What emotion did the queen feel when the cat purred?
questions.answer: She felt reassured and less afraid after seeing the cat's gentle side.

questions.question: How did the villagers treat Dick in his hometown?
questions.answer: They treated him unkindly because he was poor and an orphan.

questions.question: What does the story suggest about the value of pets?
questions.answer: Pets can bring unexpected fortune, companionship, and solutions to problems.

questions.question: How did Dick's poverty shape his character?
questions.answer: It made him resilient, hardworking, and appreciative of opportunities.

questions.question: What is the significance of Dick being elected Lord Mayor three times?
questions.answer: It shows he was highly respected, capable, and beloved by the people of London.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'worthy citizen' imply about Dick?
questions.answer: It implies he was honorable, responsible, and contributed positively to society.

questions.question: How did the captain describe the cat to the queen?
questions.answer: He said she was very friendly with people and would rid the kingdom of pests.

questions.question: What motivated Dick to work hard even when mistreated?
questions.answer: His hope for a better future and his desire to prove his worth kept him going.

questions.question: What is the moral of Dick Whittington's story?
questions.answer: Goodness, patience, and seizing opportunities can turn misfortune into fortune.

questions.question: How did Alice Fitzwarren's kindness affect Dick?
questions.answer: Her kindness gave him emotional support and later led to their marriage.

questions.question: What does the story teach about judging people by their circumstances?
questions.answer: It warns against underestimating someone based on their current situation.

questions.question: Why was Dick's cat more valuable than the entire cargo?
questions.answer: Because it solved a critical problem for the kingdom, making it priceless to them.

questions.question: How did Dick's story become a legend?
questions.answer: It was passed down as an inspiring tale of rags-to-riches and kindness rewarded.

questions.question: What does the term 'attlc' refer to in the story?
questions.answer: A small room under a sloping roof where Dick slept, infested with rats.

questions.question: Why did Dick sleep in an alley on his first night in London?
questions.answer: He had nowhere else to go and hoped to stay safe there.

questions.question: How did the cook treat Dick at Mr. Fitzwarren's house?
questions.answer: She had a bad temper, shouted at him, and hit him with a wooden spoon.

questions.question: What does Dick's purchase of a cat reveal about his problem-solving skills?
questions.answer: It shows he was resourceful and took initiative to improve his situation.

questions.question: Why is the story set in London significant?
questions.answer: London was a center of trade and opportunity, making it a fitting place for Dick's rise.

questions.question: How did Dick's honesty with Mr. Fitzwarren help him?
questions.answer: It built trust and led to the opportunity that changed his life.

questions.question: What does the story suggest about the power of belief?
questions.answer: Belief in oneself and one's future can inspire perseverance and courage.

questions.question: Why did Dick tell his story to his grandchildren?
questions.answer: To teach them about humility, hard work, and how fortune can come unexpectedly.

questions.question: What role did trade play in Dick's success?
questions.answer: International trade created the opportunity for his cat to be sold at a high price.

questions.question: How did Dick's status change in society after his fortune?
questions.answer: He went from a homeless orphan to a respected merchant, mayor, and knight.

questions.question: What does the story teach about patience?
questions.answer: Patience during difficult times can lead to great rewards.

questions.question: Why is Dick Whittington remembered in history?
questions.answer: As a symbol of how integrity and perseverance can lead to extraordinary success.

questions.question: How did the cat's behavior change the queen's perception?
questions.answer: From fear to admiration when she saw it was gentle with people.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'turn again' symbolize for Dick?
questions.answer: It symbolizes a second chance and the decision to persevere rather than give up.

questions.question: How did Dick's relationship with Alice develop?
questions.answer: It grew from kindness and mutual respect into marriage.

questions.question: What lesson does the story offer about dealing with hardship?
questions.answer: Facing hardship with courage and hope can lead to unexpected positive outcomes.

questions.question: Why did the king pay ten times the cargo's value for the cat?
questions.answer: Because the cat provided a solution to a serious and ongoing problem in his kingdom.

questions.question: What does Dick's story teach about generosity?
questions.answer: Generosity to others, especially after becoming successful, brings respect and fulfillment.

questions.question: How did Dick's early struggles prepare him for leadership?
questions.answer: They taught him resilience, empathy, and the value of hard work.

questions.question: What universal theme does Dick Whittington's story represent?
questions.answer: The universal theme of hope, transformation, and the reward of virtue.
